alert.note: Alert for Rankin (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 24 at 2:15PM CDT until further notice by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Mississippi, including the following counties, Hinds and Rankin. * WHEN...Until 615 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 215 PM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 3 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Jackson, Pearl, Brandon, Flowood, Richland, Star, Florence, Pelahatchie, Monterey, Fannin, Johns, Cato, Piney Woods, Goshen Springs, Pisgah, Leesburg, Whites and Puckett. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
